poem:
### Ode to Jim O'Neill

In Ilford lanes, a cab's course was spun,  
Jim, bearing "The Knowledge" under the sun,  
Defying the mold, a socialist heart,  
Spurs chants echoing, a world apart.  
Steering black streets with kindness, bright,  
A driver of life, through his own light.  
In every turn, a story lent,  
Jim, a gentle testament.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Jim O’Neill obituary My friend Jim O’Neill, who has died of a heart attack aged 65, found his calling 20 years ago when he passed the London taxi cab “Knowledge” test. A devoted Spurs fan who lived his entire life in Ilford, east London, and thus on the face of it a black cab driver straight out of central casting, Jim upended the profession’s sometimes negative stereotype with his socialist views, unstinting kindness and cheerful". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
